page.title: 09Changes in Horton.
page.content: We talked to a man who has lived in Horton all his life.He used to be a Wheelwright.He said that in his time (80 years) transport has changed a lot from horse pulled carts to cars to concorde.The price of things has changed as well- 80 years ago a school dinner cost 1 penny now it costs about 65p.80 years ago there were 90 pupils in the local school now there are only 25,and the school has to close down and the pupils are to go to Old Sodbury.But there is one thing that has not changed,landscape.The man who we talked to said that a lot of people say they are glad to see the landscape has not changed but modern transport is better because they have to go into town to shop.
